intro: Vernonia silvae, commonly known as the forest ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of forests, preferring rich, loamy soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Vernonia silvae plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
